author: Sneha Chakraborty
title: Red Alert Issued for Karnataka and Telangana Amid Heavy Rain Forecast
text:
The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has issued a red alert for very heavy rainfall in Karnataka and Telangana from August 27 to 29, 2025. Coastal Karnataka is also expected to experience widespread heavy showers from August 27 to September 2.
Residents in these regions are advised to remain vigilant and follow all official advisories and guidelines. Itâ€™s crucial to avoid low-lying areas and plan any travel with extreme caution to ensure safety. The IMD has advised residents to stay alert, keep updated with local advisories, avoid low-lying areas, and prepare for potential disruptions.
Explore our guide to the best places to visit in Telangana for a unique experience, once the weather clears.
Karnataka and Telangana on red alert: What you need to know
Rain Alert: Coastal Karnataka & Telangana!
On 27th August, extremely heavy rainfall is likely over the Coastal Karnataka and Telangana, with intense showers expected to impact daily life and travel.

Heavy to very heavy rainfall is expected in Telangana until August 29, 2025. Coastal Karnataka is predicted to experience widespread heavy rainfall until September 2. Additionally, isolated heavy rainfall is likely in Coastal Andhra Pradesh, Yanam, Telangana, Kerala, Mahe, and Tamil Nadu until August 29, 2025.
â€œResidents are advised to stay updated with local advisories, avoid low-lying areas, and plan accordingly for safety and preparedness,â€ an advisory issued by the IMD said.
IMD warning for fishermen (until September 1, 2025):
- In an
IMD noticereleased on August 27, 2025, fishermen were advised not to venture along and off the Somalia and Oman coasts, and adjoining areas of the central Arabian Sea, until September 1, 2025. - They are also warned against venturing into adjoining areas of the southwest Arabian Sea from August 28 to September 1, 2025.
- Fishermen have been further cautioned against venturing into the Lakshadweep and Comorin areas, as well as along and off the coasts of south Gujarat, Konkan, Goa, Karnataka, and Kerala.
